result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Eugene Louis Richards was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Eugene Louis Richards was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eugene Louis Richards

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 23 days time served. Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $600.00 plus all mandatory costs and surcharges by 1/9/2017. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 24 months. Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 12 months to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.  


As to Count 3:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 23 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   No firearms; weapons


 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit,received and filed.

Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to Counts 1 & 3:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

As to Counts 2 & 4:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Eugene Louis Richards not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.
  Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No reply from defendant or surety.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($1000.00) gj
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Eugene Louis Richards not in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program report dated October 15, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-To Withdraw from Attorney Mark Pecora; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program report dated September 21, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 37
Received & Filed, WCS Violation Report. Discussion regarding bail. Court set bail at $1,000.00 CASH with turnover to Justice Point. All conditions remain the same.

Court ordered $300.00 additional to be posted. Court ordered all conditions to remain the same. Defendant taken into custody.

Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri on behalf of attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Case in court due to WCS Program violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court amends cash bail. Defendant taken into custody. Case remains calendared for Projected guilty plea and sentencing on October 15, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 37.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program violation report; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.

CASE RECALLED AT 9:22 A.M.

Present in court is WCS Case Worker Erica Perez-Torres related to case #'s 15CM2053 and 15CT755 for WCS report clarification. Defendant needs additional time to complete treatment. Court ordered defendant report to WCS Program immediately after today's proceedings.  Court ordered defendant to continue monitoring with WCS Program, SCRAM and pay all fees of agency. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program report dated August 11, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, additional time needed to review. Court admonished the defendant as to WCS Program violation and ordered to report immediately after today's proceedings.  For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant REFERRED TO WCS for supervision upon leaving court if they are eligible for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers. Court ordered the Scram Bracelet.
IF THEY FAIL TO REPORT TO WCS A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in court with Christina E. Balisterei for  attorney Mark A Pecora.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37. Defendant Eugene Louis Richards in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
AODA form placed in file
